summary: Checked 89 verifiable claims in tech-spec. Found 1 critical mirage (incorrect function name reference). All other claims verified against codebase.

findings.claim: tech-spec Task 6 (line 486) references 'sendBitcoin' function in src/common/utils/coin/btc.ts
findings.reality: File src/common/utils/coin/btc.ts does NOT export a 'sendBitcoin' function. The exported functions are: fetchBalance, fetchTx, fetchTxInfo, fetchUnspents, broadcastTx, checkWithdraw, fetchTxRaw, getTransactionBlocyper, getFeesRateBlockcypher, estimateFeeValue, estimateFeeRate, calculateTxSize, getCore, prepareFees, prepareRawTx, prepareUnspents, fetchTxInputScript. The actual transaction sending is done via the 'send' function in src/front/shared/redux/actions/btc.ts (line 323).
findings.source: tech-spec.md, Task 6: BTC Operations (Balance + Transactions), Files to read section, line 486
findings.fix: Replace '(sendBitcoin)' with '(send function in btc.ts actions)' or remove the specific function name reference since btc.ts exports broadcastTx and prepareRawTx as the core building blocks, while the higher-level 'send' logic lives in the Redux action layer.
